channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [MAHOUT-1649] Upgrade to Lucene 4.10.x
item.description: Upgrade lucene2seq utility and seq2sparse to Lucene 4.10.x

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
Upgrading to Lucene 5.0.0 was not trivial but I managed to updrade to Lucene 4.10.3 with passing build and tests https://github.com/frankscholten/mahout/commit/aaaa61c918336848fb3c6797f947cd336863f8be

lucene2seq has to be tested on a Hadoop cluster
Yeah, upgrading to Lucene 5 isn't trivial given the changed APIs and agree that moving to Lucene 4.10.3 is a logical first step.

Frank, let's upgrade to Lucene 4.10.4 for 0.10.0 release. I tried upgrading to Lucene 5 today and realized I was spending more time trying to figure out the API changes, lets go with 4.10.4 for the release next week.

FAILURE: Integrated in Mahout-Quality #3073 (See https://builds.apache.org/job/Mahout-Quality/3073/)
MAHOUT-1649: Upgrade to be Lucene 4.10.4 compatible, patch from Frank Scholten (suneel.marthi: rev 4cff54295d9e494eaff46a190b73bcb8d491f7e5)

GitHub user andrewmusselman opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/113

Revert "MAHOUT-1649: Upgrade to be Lucene 4.10.4 compatible, patch from ...

...Frank Scholten"

This reverts commit 4cff54295d9e494eaff46a190b73bcb8d491f7e5.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/andrewmusselman/mahout fix-lucene

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/mahout/pull/113.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #113

commit db624ef35c8174e9bd5a9f63f9e2957e8bd594b8
Author: Andrew Musselman <akm@apache.org>
